    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static JSONValue get(java.lang.Object object)
        Create a JSON structure representation of the parameter object. For the conversion the method use any of the next rules.
        • If the object is a Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, BigInteger, or BigDecimal object the method use a JSONNumber.
        • If a property is a byte, short, int, long, float, or double type, the method use a JSONNumber.
        • If the object or a property is a Boolean object the method use a JSONBoolean.
        • If some property is a boolean type the method use a JSONBoolean.
        • If the object or a property is a Character, String, Date, GregorianCalendar, or Class object the method convert it to a JSONString.
        • If a property is a char type the method convert it to a JSONString.
        • If a property is a byte[] type the method use a JSONArray.
        • If the conversion can't be done using this rules the system try to convert the object using the JSONProperty annotation.
        Parameters:
        object - the POJO to create the JSON structure from.
        Returns:
        a JSONValue with a JSON structure.
